sentences.sContent: Scientists set up an avian casino in which pigeons could place their bets on one of two symbols.
sentences.sContent_eng: Scientists set up an avian casino in which pigeons could place their bets on one of two symbols.
sentences.sCn: 科学家们设置了一个鸟类的“卡西诺赌场”，在那里放上两个标志以供鸽子下赌注。

sentences.sContent: From 1917 to 1957, New Jersey's Fort Monmouth served as the breeding and training ground for these avian soldiers.
sentences.sContent_eng: From 1917 to 1957, New Jersey's Fort Monmouth served as the breeding and training ground for these avian soldiers.
sentences.sCn: 从1917年到1957年，新泽西的福特蒙茅斯被用作饲养和训练这些鸟类战士的基地。

phrases.pCn: 禽流感；家禽流行性感冒

remMethod.val: avi(鸟) + an → 鸟； 鸟类的

trans.tranOther: of, relating to, or resembling a bird
